titles.title: Sekai Meisaku Douwa: Manga Series
My Favorite Fairy Tales (2)
Classic Tales Retold
World Famous Fairy Tale Series
世界名作童話まんがシリーズ
The World`s Greatest Fairy Tales
Cuentos Clásicos
Τα ωραιότερα παραμύθια
(2) אגדות ילדים

anime.description: Another of http://anidb.net/cr1009 [Toei]`s World Famous Fairy Tale series consisting of 20 stories, 10 minutes each. [i]Note: It`s not known how exactly they were released, but Toei`s English languaged page seems to suggest a direct-to-video release with 10 episodes on November 1975, 5 episodes on February 1979 and another 5 on February 1983. This, however, is contradicting the claim of first ever OVA animation being released in 1983. The original Japanese title for the entire series is also missing an official source. In 1977 it was adapted by Fred Ladd of Greatest Tales, Inc. for the American market. Furthermore, the last 4 episodes have also been released as part of the Saban`s My Favorite Fairy Tales series in 1986.[/i]

tag.name: maintenance tags
tag.description: These tags are used for maintenance.

tag.name: themes
tag.description: Themes describe the very central elements important to the anime stories. They set the backdrop against which the protagonists must face their challenges. Be it School Life, present Daily Life, Military action, Cyberpunk, Law and Order detective work, Sports, or the Underworld. These are only but a few of the more typical backgrounds for anime plots. Add to that a Conspiracy setting with a possible tragic outcome, the Themes span most of the imaginable subject matter relevant to anime.

tag.name: fairy tale
tag.description: This anime is either based on or contains parts of fairy tales. Usually those parts are highly modified or twisted when compared with the original source.

tag.name: mythology
tag.description: The anime gets inspirations from many forms of mythologies (either Greek, Egyptian, Nord, etc.) to form its story and setting.

tag.name: folklore
tag.description: Folklore, or simply Lore, are the traditions of a culture, subculture, or group, in the form of legends, music, proverbs, jokes, popular beliefs, fairy tales, stories, tall tales and customs. In usage, there is a continuum between folklore and mythology. Folklore is generally divided into four areas of study: physical artifacts, transmissible entities and stories, culture and technologies, and behaviors and rituals. [From Wikipedia]

tag.name: DESCRIPTION MISSING
tag.description: The description for this entry is missing. e.g plot, biography... Please help by adding it, and remove this tag afterwards. Thank you.

tag.name: Greek mythology
tag.description: The anime is derived or draws elements from the Greek mythology, and as such features some mythological characteristics of Ancient Greece. Those may be creatures, such as the Centaur or Hydra, tales, such as that of the Trojan War, or even the Gods themselves, like Zeus or Poseidon. More subtle references also count, such as the careful usage of names of places or people that hold significance in the myths.

tag.name: CAST MISSING
tag.description: Important characters are missing, either in-part or entirely. This includes basic entry info (name, gender, picture), appear episode range, seiyuu and/or tags.
